details.description: Get or renew your passport for free if you are a British national born on or before 2 September 1929
details.body:
If you are a British national and were born on or before 2 September 1929, you can get or renew a passport for free.

How to get your free passport

Situation Action
You’ve held a British passport Renew your passport
You’ve never held a British passport Apply for your first adult passport

You can use the standard service or the Post Office Check & Send service free of charge.

You must pay a fee if you need to get a passport urgently.

Help with your application because of a disability

The Identity and Passport Service offers special services for people with disabilities.

If you recently paid for a passport

You can apply for a refund of the standard passport fee if both conditions apply:

  • you’ve applied for a passport since 19 May 2004
  • you’re eligible for a free passport

Contact the Passport Adviceline.

Passport Adviceline

Telephone: 0300 222 0000
Textphone: 0300 222 0222
Text Relay: 18001 0300 222 0000
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, Sunday and public holidays, 9am to 5:30pm
